item.title: An Inside Look at Book Publishing & Literary Marketing in a Digital World
item.dc:creator: jessica
item.description:
F. Scott Fitzgerald once said, "You don't write because you want to say something, you write because you have something to say." These days, it seems like everyone has something to say: the average Joe, celebrities and fantasy enthusiasts with imaginations that put Roald Dahl's witches and candy men to shame. Everyone believes they are bringing something new and exciting to the bookstore shelf, and maybe they are. But the way that value is recognized has morphed. It has moved off the page and into the online space.

The post An Inside Look at Book Publishing & Literary Marketing in a Digital World appeared first on Jessica Barraco.

item.title: Singles: Don’t mope on Valentine’s Day
item.dc:creator: jessica
item.description:
Originally published in the Denver Post [source] On Sunday, couples will celebrate Valentine’s Day with cards, flowers, sweets and intimate dates. Singles will bide their time till Monday. The highly publicized day for sweethearts can cause a self-esteem blow to those who are unattached. While some try to avoid it or revel in “Single Awareness Day” activities instead, the best way to deal with it is to learn how to romance yourself, relationship experts say. “I remember when I made […]

The post Singles: Don’t mope on Valentine’s Day appeared first on Jessica Barraco.
